description: Describes the specified the load balancers. If no load balancers are specified, the call describes all of your load balancers.

parameters.name: LoadBalancerNames
parameters.description: The names of the load balancers. (string) ---

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerDescriptions
nested_items.description: Information about the load balancers.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerName
nested_items.description: The name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: DNSName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: CanonicalHostedZoneName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: CanonicalHostedZoneNameID
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: ListenerDescriptions
nested_items.description: The listeners for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerPort
nested_items.description: The port on which the load balancer is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can specify any port from the range 1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587, 1024-65535.

nested_items.name: InstanceProtocol
nested_items.description: The protocol to use for routing traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL.

nested_items.name: InstancePort
nested_items.description: The port on which the instance is listening.

nested_items.name: SSLCertificateId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.

nested_items.name: PolicyNames
nested_items.description: The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AppCookieStickinessPolicies
nested_items.description: The stickiness policies created using  CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The mnemonic name for the policy being created. The name must be unique within a set of policies for this load balancer.

nested_items.name: CookieName
nested_items.description: The name of the application cookie used for stickiness.

nested_items.name: LBCookieStickinessPolicies
nested_items.description: The stickiness policies created using  CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The name of the policy. This name must be unique within the set of policies for this load balancer.

nested_items.name: CookieExpirationPeriod
nested_items.description: The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness session lasts for the duration of the browser session.

nested_items.name: OtherPolicies
nested_items.description: The policies other than the stickiness policies.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BackendServerDescriptions
nested_items.description: Information about your EC2 instances.

nested_items.name: InstancePort
nested_items.description: The port on which the EC2 instance is listening.

nested_items.name: PolicyNames
nested_items.description: The names of the policies enabled for the EC2 instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VPCId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The instance ID.

nested_items.name: HealthCheck
nested_items.description: Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Target
nested_items.description: The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS, or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.

nested_items.name: Interval
nested_items.description: The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an individual instance.

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health check.

nested_items.name: UnhealthyThreshold
nested_items.description: The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving the instance to the Unhealthy state.

nested_items.name: HealthyThreshold
nested_items.description: The number of consecutive health checks successes required before moving the instance to the Healthy state.

nested_items.name: SourceSecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The security group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of your inbound rules for your registered instances. To only allow traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule that specifies this source security group as the inbound source.

nested_items.name: OwnerAlias
nested_items.description: The owner of the security group.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the security group.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the load balancer was created.

nested_items.name: Scheme
nested_items.description: The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.
